text: Richard Alan "R. J." Umberger, Jr. (born May 3, 1982) is an American former professional ice hockey center. He played parts of 11 seasons in the National Hockey League (NHL). He played for the Philadelphia Flyers and Columbus Blue Jackets. He was drafted by the Vancouver Canucks with the 16th overall pick in the 2001 NHL Draft but did not play a game with them. He also played for Philadelphia Flyers from 2004 to 2008. He played college hockey at Ohio State University. On June 23, 2014, Umberger was traded back to the Philadelphia Flyers along with a 2015 4th round draft pick for Scott Hartnell. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1982 births Category:Living people Category:American ice hockey centers Category:Columbus Blue Jackets players Category:Philadelphia Flyers players Category:Philadelphia Phantoms players Category:Sportspeople from Pittsburgh Category:United States Hockey League players
title: R. J. Umberger
